describe: Lebanon is a country in the Middle East, known for its rich history, diverse culture, and beautiful landscapes ranging from Mediterranean beaches to snow-capped mountains. It has a vibrant cultural scene and is famous for its cuisine, hospitality, and historical sites.

cities.name: 🏝 Beirut
cities.geographical_location: Located on the Mediterranean coast, Beirut is the capital and largest city of Lebanon.
cities.climate: Beirut has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters.

cities.name: 🏝 Byblos
cities.geographical_location: Byblos is situated on the coast, north of Beirut, and is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.
cities.climate: Byblos experiences a Mediterranean climate with warm, dry summers and mild, wet winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Seafood dishes, especially grilled fish and octopus

cities.name: 🕌 Baalbek
cities.geographical_location: Located in the Beqaa Valley, Baalbek is known for its well-preserved Roman ruins.
cities.climate: Baalbek has a semi-arid climate with hot summers and cool, wet winters.

cities.name: 🏝 Tripoli
cities.geographical_location: Tripoli is located in northern Lebanon, along the Mediterranean coast.
cities.climate: Tripoli has a Mediterranean climate with hot, humid summers and mild, rainy winters.
